Name: market for methanol, from biomass | methanol, from biomass | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9240/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'methanol, from biomass', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;'methanol, from biomass'  is an organic substance with a CAS no. : 000067-56-1. It is called 'methanol' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: CH4O. It is liquid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure and has a pungent odour. The substance is modelled as a pure substance. On a consumer level, is used in the following products: washing & cleaning products, anti-freeze products and fuels. On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: laboratory chemicals, water treatment chemicals, fuels and washing & cleaning products. This substance is used for the synthesis of other substances (use as intermediate).

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'methanol, from biomass',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'methanol, from biomass',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
